# Bibliography







lark, Donald N. Christianity in Modern Korea. Lanham: University Press of America, 1986.

Fraser, Donald. Fraser Report: Human Rights and U.S. Foreign Policy. Washington, D.C.: U.S. House Committee on International Relations, 1976.

Jeong, Byeong-jun. “The Park Chung Hee Regime and Christianity: A Historiographical Study on Church-State Relations.” Korean Christianity and Thought 40 (2007): 7–87.

Kang, In-chul. Church and Democracy in South Korea: The Role of Christian Movements in the Democratization Process, 1960–1987. Seoul: Hanul Academy, 2011.

Kim, Heung-soo. “A History and Typology of Korean Christianity’s Engagement in Politics.” Theological Thought 160 (2011): 59–98.

Kim, Kirsteen. “Christian Mission in the Public Life of Korea: Foreign Missions and Their Legacy.” International Bulletin of Mission Research 36, no. 2 (2012): 89–94.

Lee, Timothy S. Born Again: Evangelicalism in Korea. Honolulu: University of Hawai‘i Press, 2010.

Ryu, Dae-young. “The Attitude of Korean Protestantism toward the Vietnam War.” Korean Church History Review 17 (2005): 177–203.

Schmid, Andre. Korea Between Empires, 1895–1919. New York: Columbia University Press, 2002.

ACTS (Asian Center for Theological Studies and Mission). Underground Church in North Korea: Testimonies and Analysis. Seoul: ACTS Press, 2002.

Keum, Jooseop. Remnants and Renewal: A History of Protestant Christianity in North Korea. PhD diss., University of Edinburgh, 2013.

Kim, Seong-tae.  The Path of Suffering of the North Korean Church and the Mission of a Unified Korean Church. Shinhak Jinan 87, no. 3 (2020): 7–28.

Kim, Sung-Soo. “North Korea’s Religious Policy and the Korean Christian Federation.” Journal of Korean Church History 32 (2009): 111–132.

Ko, Byung-Chul. Modern Korean Religious Law and Policy. Seoul: Pakmunsa, 2021.

Lee, Keun-Young. Christianity and Politics in Korea. Seoul: Joeunddang, 2020.

Park, Myung-Soo. “Theological Reflections on Korean Revivalism and Developmentalism.” Korean Church History Review 28 (2019): 87–104.

Statistics Korea. Census on Religion. Seoul: KOSTAT, 1985.
